provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4.-(1) All lands and hereditaments, being those set out and Vesting of
described in the Schedule, and all the goods, chattels and personal Property.
                                                                       Schedule.
property which are now the legal and equitable property ofthe Church,
are now held in trust for the purpose ofthe Church or are now held or
possessed on behalfofthe Church by officials, officers, members of
the Church or any ofthem are hereby transferred to and vested in the
Corporation, its successors and assigns and are subject to all trusts,
mortgages, charge~, rights, reservations or encumbrances (if any)
affecting same or any part thereof.
4               [No.            The Power ofFaith Ministries International
                                  (Incorporation and Vesting) Act, 2014
                       (2) All property real and personal bequeathed by Will or
                otherwise given to the Church shall be held by, and is hereby vested in
                and shall be deemed to be the property ofthe Corporation.
                        (3) In case there shall be any real orpersonal property held on
                trust such property shall be deemed to be vested in the Corporation as
                from the coming into effect ofthis Act upon the same trusts as those
                referred in subsection (1); provided that no such vesting shall take
                place until­
                       (a) the Corporation shall have obtained written legal advice to
                           the effect that the said property is held on similar trust as
                           aforesaid; and
                       (b) the majority of members of the church or congregation
                           affected shall by resolution signify their consent thereto.
                        (4) In the case ofany other church or congregation desiring to
                unite with the corporation and to adopt its tenets doctrines and forms
                ofworship and to submit to its jurisdiction, the Corporation may ac­
                cept the transfer ofthe property ofsuch church to be held subject to
                the trusts affecting the property under the resolution ofsuch clnm:h or
                congregation by the like majorities and the like manner as would au­
                thorize a sale ofthe same lands, or otherwise duly passed in accor­
                dance with the rules or practices ofsuch church or congregation.
Powers of the      5. The Corporation shall have the following powers:­
Corporation.
                       (a) to acquire, hold, purchase, receive, lease, possess and enjoy
                           any lands or hereditament whatsoever in fee simple, for
                           leasehold or for any other estate or interest therein and all
                           other property real, personal, or mixed;
                       (b) to give, grant, let, charge, improve, develop, exchange, lease,
                           mortgage, sell, convey, assign, dispose of, turn to account,
                           or otheIwise deal with all or any ofthe property both nh .I:lf nt
                           and future so held or vested or any part thereof;
               The Power ofFaith Ministries International        [No. ]         5
                 (Incorporation and Vesting) Act, 2014
     (c) to borrow or raise or secure the payment ofmoney in such
         manner as may be thought fit, and in particular by issues of
         debenture or script charged upon all or any ofthe property
         (bothpresentand future) held by or vested in the Corporation
         and to redeem and payoff such securities;
     (d) to appoint anAttorney orAttorneys ofthe Corporation either
         generally or for a limited period and for such purposes and
         with such powers as may be stated in the Power ofAttomey
         and to revoke any such appointment; and
     (e) to make such rules and by-laws as they shall think fit in order
         to carry out the purpose ofthis Act.
